FuncDef:
The virtual-cluster-access command enables virtual cluster access and displays the virtual cluster access view.
The undo virtual-cluster-access command disables virtual cluster access.
By default, virtual cluster access is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the existing IP RAN bearer solutions, a large number of dynamic signaling protocols need to run on an access ring, which imposes heavy pressure on access devices. Because a large number of devices are deployed on the access ring, configurations and maintenance consume a large amount of time and manpower. IP RAN virtual cluster access resolves these issues. To deploy IP RAN virtual cluster access on a node, run the virtual-cluster-access command to enable virtual cluster access on the node.
Configuration Impact
After you globally enable virtual cluster access on a device, the device automatically establishes a virtual cluster access Intermediate System to Intermediate System (IS-IS) process and globally enables Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).
Follow-up Procedure
Run the role master command to specify a master role for the node.Run the admin command to configure a management IP address for the node.
